com.yourmediashelf.fedora.akubra
Class UUIDDatePathIdMapper

java.lang.Object
  com.yourmediashelf.fedora.akubra.UUIDDatePathIdMapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper
public class UUIDDatePathIdMapper
extends Object
implements org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper

An Akubra IdMapper that maps version 1 UUIDs (i.e., time-based UUIDs) to datetime-based paths.

This IdMapper should be configured to use a fallbackMapper, to handle ids which are not version 1 UUIDs.

Author:
Edwin Shin

Constructor Detail

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper()

Convenience constructor that uses the default dateFormat, fallbackMapper and no IdMapperPrefixer.

Note: the default fallbackMapper (TrivialIdMapper) is probably not what you should be using.

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper(String dateFormat)

Convenience constructor that uses the default fallbackMapper.

Note: the default fallbackMapper (TrivialIdMapper) is probably not what you should be using.

Parameters:
dateFormat - A DateTimeFormat pattern to generate the path.
See Also:

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper(org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper fallbackMapper)

Convenience constructor that uses the default dateFormat and no IdMapperPrefixer.

Parameters:
fallbackMapper - The IdMapper implementation to use when encountering an id which is not a version 1 UUID.

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper(String dateFormat,
                            org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper fallbackMapper)

Convenience constructor that uses no IdMapperPrefixer.

Parameters:
dateFormat - A DateTimeFormat pattern to generate the path. If null or empty, defaults to "yyyy/MM/dd".
fallbackMapper - The IdMapper to use if/when we encounter an id that is not a version 1 UUID. If null, defaults to TrivialIdMapper.
See Also:

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper(org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper fallbackMapper,
                            IdMapperPrefixer prefixer)
Convenience constructor that uses the default dateFormat.

Parameters:
fallbackMapper - The IdMapper to use if/when we encounter an id that is not a version 1 UUID. If null, defaults to TrivialIdMapper.
prefixer - The IdMapperPrefixer to use, or null.
See Also:

UUIDDatePathIdMapper

public UUIDDatePathIdMapper(String dateFormat,
                            org.akubraproject.map.IdMapper fallbackMapper,
                            IdMapperPrefixer prefixer)
Parameters:
dateFormat - A DateTimeFormat pattern to generate the path. If null or empty, defaults to "yyyy/MM/dd".
fallbackMapper - The IdMapper to use if/when we encounter an id that is not a version 1 UUID. If null, defaults to TrivialIdMapper.
prefixer - The IdMapperPrefixer to use, or null.

extractUUID

protected UUID extractUUID(String s)
                    throws NullPointerException,
                           IllegalArgumentException
Searches for and returns a UUID embedded in the supplied string.

Parameters:
s - Any string that contains a UUID in canonical form.
Returns:
UUID The UUID contained in the supplied string.
Throws:
NullPointerException
IllegalArgumentException - if the input does not contain a UUID

getDateTime

protected org.joda.time.DateTime getDateTime(UUID uuid)
Get the DateTime from a version 1 UUID.

Parameters:
uuid - a version 1 UUID
Returns:
DateTime value extracted from the UUID, or IllegalArgumentException if uuid is not a version 1 UUID.
